item.title: The !kain who snatched off the hair of the Ostrich's head, and put it on his own head
item.summary: The !käin (formerly a man of the early race, and now a little bird which is said to resemble the Lanius collaris), the Ostrich, and the Lizard. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-30. 8668-8670). The !kain snatches the Ostrich's (the toi) head-hair, because he is vain and covets it (the Ostriches are also people of the Early Race). The !khau snatches the hair and pulls it over his own head.
item.comments: 1) p.8667v: |han≠kass'o heard this from his mother (|xabbi-an); the !kain bird, 2) This story is found in Book VIII-30
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
